column4: ok...i guess try it again. do you see anything that says "keycode"?
first, install xev
then let me know when you're ready :-)
its installed
sweet. can you open a terminal?
and then type "xev" (no quotes)
then click on the xev window, and you'll see lots of output in the terminal
btw i can find anumber of hp keyboards to choose from in system:keyboard, but all same functions
right im there
and then press your www key, and look fr something that says "keycode somenumber." write down "somenumber"
ok then what?
you got somenumber?
nope
anything promising?
no keycode anyway
hmmm. it should give you one. you're not using an hp are you?
aha. i am too, and for some reason i can set up all my other ones but that one doesn't seem to "exist"
here's something you can do, though
you can set up a keybinding to run firefox (or whatever). i think that'll be in the gnome menu
yeah
ive used keybinding before, thanks again
sweet. sorry i couldn't help more
